clinical_study.brief_title: The Changes of CD4+T Lymphocyte Subsets in Septic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of CD4+T Lymphocyte Subsets in Cell Immunity in Patients With Sepsis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the value of CD4+T lymphocyte subsets in cell immunity in the patients with sepsis.There are immunoparalysis in septic patients,the important player is the change of CD4+T lymphocyte,this immunoparalysis state contribute to the illness progress and outcome. Comprehend the change regularity of septic patients' cell immunity can guide fiter and correcter treatment.

arm_group.description: (1) temperature > 38oC or < 36oC; (2) pulse rate > 90 beats/min; (3) ventilation rate > 20 breaths/min or hyperventilation with a partial pressure of arterial carbon dioxide (PaCO2) < 32 mmHg; (4) white blood cell (WBC) count >1 2,000μL-1 or < 4000 μL-1 , or > 10% immature cells.
not SIRS and have no infection

study_pop.textblock: All subjects were selected from among inpatients who were hospitalized between March 2010 and March 2011 in the Respiratory ICU, Surgical ICU, and Emergency ICU, Chinese People's Liberation Army (CPLA) General Hospital.

overall_official.affiliation: Department Of Respiratory Diseases, Chinese PLA General Hospital
